item.title: Pursuit Curves
item.description: Generating interesting patterns using pursuit curves Let’s say we have a point A traveling on an arbitrary path and another point B pursuing point A such that its velocity is always directed towards point A. The path traced by point B is called a pursuit curve. The tangent of the pursuit curve will always pass through the pursuee’s position at that moment of time. With this simple rule, nothing special happens if the pursuee is just traveling on a fixed path with a constant velocity.
